title: (x) HP Packaging - ITC Century {Yves, Adriano, Mark S}
content:
This is probably something obvious I should know. Anyone?   
   
Thanks. ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20050516141113im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/19046.jpg)
author: dctroy

comments.content: It seems to me that it's [ITC Century](http://web.archive.org/web/20050516141113/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/itc-century/book/testdrive.html?s=PrinterPal&p=72) with tweaked cap heights...

You can tell it's ITC Century because of the one-sided serif   
on the right leg of the lowercase n. In all other versions,   
this is a feature that only shows up in the bold weights.   
Presumably, ITC did it for consistency. Call me old-   
fashioned, but it's always bugged the heck out of me.

OK, you're old-fashioned.   
   
But in the good way.
Hah! I _knew_ somebody was going to say that!

Well, I was on vacation for a week and was mostly deprived of email and almost completely deprived of web stuff. Other than that, I just haven't been getting the IDs like I used to. There's a ton of new talent on this board!
